content.p: The adjoining diagram illustrates the major organs of the endocrine system labeled with numbers.

body.p: Identify each organ from the above image.

response.feedback: Correct. The pineal gland secretes the melatonin hormone.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus is anterior and inferior to this organ.
Incorrect. The meninges are protective coverings around the brain and spinal cord and are not an endocrine organ.
Incorrect. The pituitary gland produces several hormones.

part.hint: This gland secretes the melatonin hormone in levels that vary with the environmental lighting. When sunlight levels are low, it secretes high levels of melatonin and induces the body to sleep.

response.feedback: Correct. The hypothalamus controls autonomic functions.
Incorrect. The cerebellum is not an endocrine organ.
Incorrect. The thymus gland is just superior to the heart.
Incorrect. The pituitary gland functions to release hormones, not to control autonomic functions.

part.hint: This structure is a brain region important for controlling hunger, body temperature and many other basic body functions.

response.feedback: Correct. The pituitary gland is the master gland.
Incorrect. The parathyroid glands are not in the brain.
Incorrect. The pineal gland is not the master gland of the body.
Incorrect. The spinal cord is not an endocrine organ and is posterior.

part.hint: This master gland controls hormone release to many endocrine glands.

response.feedback: Correct. The thyroid and parathyroid glands secrete hormones.
Incorrect. The trachea is near these glands and is not an endocrine organ.
Incorrect. The gonads produce sex hormones.
Incorrect. The adrenal glands are superior to the kidney.

part.hint: These glands secrete hormones affecting metabolism, bone formation and blood calcium levels.

response.feedback: Correct. The thymus functions in both the immune and endocrine systems.
Incorrect. The thyroid gland is superior to this organ.
Incorrect. The heart is inferior to this organ.
Incorrect. The lungs are not an endocrine organ and are easily seen lateral to this organ.

part.hint: This gland functions in the immune and endocrine systems by stimulating production of T-cells to fight foreign and abnormal cells.

response.feedback: Correct. The adrenal gland produces adrenaline.
Incorrect. The kidney is inferior to this organ.
Incorrect. The pancreas is deep to this organ and does not produce adrenaline.
Incorrect. The spleen is superficial to this organ and is not part of the endocrine system.

part.hint: A rush of adrenaline secreted by this gland may be your friend during times of stress or danger.

response.feedback: Correct. The pancreas produces insulin.
Incorrect. The adrenal gland does not produce insulin.
Incorrect. The thymus gland is superior to the heart and does not produce insulin.
Incorrect. The stomach is superior to this organ.

part.hint: People with diabetes have altered levels of insulin secreted by this gland.

response.feedback: Correct. Gonads produce gametes.
Incorrect. The adrenal gland are superior and do not produce gametes.
Incorrect. These glands are superior and do not produce gametes.
Incorrect. The hypothalamus is in the brain but it does secrete hormones that regulate these organs.

part.hint: These glands secrete hormones controlling the production of sperm, eggs, and gender characteristics.
